title: How to Restore a Computer to Factory Settings in Windows 7

steps.title: Back up and save all important documents and files to an external disk, flash drive, or cloud storage system.
steps.content: Back up and save all important documents and files to an external disk, flash drive, or cloud storage system. Restoring the original factory settings will erase all personal data from the computer.

steps.title: Power off your computer and disconnect any extra accessories or peripherals.
steps.content: Power off your computer and disconnect any extra accessories or peripherals. This includes printers, scanners, network cables, and USB drives. Remove your laptop from its docking station, if applicable.

steps.title: Power on your computer and press F8 repeatedly when the Dell logo displays on-screen.
steps.content: Power on your computer and press F8 repeatedly when the Dell logo displays on-screen. This opens the Advanced Boot Options menu. If the Advanced Boot Options menu fails to open, restart your computer and try again.

steps.title: Select “Repair Your Computer” using the arrow keys, then press “Enter.
steps.content: Select “Repair Your Computer” using the arrow keys, then press “Enter. ” This opens the System Recovery Options menu

steps.title: Select a keyboard layout and click “Next.
steps.content: Select a keyboard layout and click “Next. ”

steps.title: Sign in as a local user or the administrator, then click “OK.
steps.content: Sign in as a local user or the administrator, then click “OK. ”

steps.title: Select either “Dell Factory Tools” or “Dell Factory Image Restore,” then click “Next.
steps.content: Select either “Dell Factory Tools” or “Dell Factory Image Restore,” then click “Next. ” This opens the Confirm Data Deletion menu.

steps.title: Place a checkmark next to “Yes, reformat hard drive and restore system software to factory condition,” then click “Next.
steps.content: Place a checkmark next to “Yes, reformat hard drive and restore system software to factory condition,” then click “Next. ” Windows 7 will begin restoring factory settings, which will take at least five minutes to complete. When finished, Windows will inform you the computer has been restored to a factory-new condition.

steps.title: Click on “Finish.
steps.content: Click on “Finish. ” Your computer will restart and the Windows 7 setup wizard will display on-screen.

steps.title: Back up and save all important documents and files to an external disk, flash drive, or cloud storage system.
steps.content: Back up and save all important documents and files to an external disk, flash drive, or cloud storage system. Restoring the original factory settings will erase all personal data from the computer.

steps.title: Power off your computer and disconnect any extra accessories or peripherals.
steps.content: Power off your computer and disconnect any extra accessories or peripherals. This includes printers, scanners, network cables, fax machines, and USB drives.

steps.title: Power on your computer and click on the “Start” menu.
steps.content: Power on your computer and click on the “Start” menu. If Windows fails to boot up correctly and you cannot access the Start menu, press F11 repeatedly as your computer reboots to bring up the Recovery Manager window, then skip to step #7.

steps.title: Click on “All Programs,” then select “Recovery Manager.
steps.content: Click on “All Programs,” then select “Recovery Manager. ”

steps.title: Click on “Recovery Manager” again, then type the administrator password.
steps.content: Click on “Recovery Manager” again, then type the administrator password.

steps.title: Select “Yes” when the User Account Control window asks if you want the program to make changes to your computer.
steps.content: Select “Yes” when the User Account Control window asks if you want the program to make changes to your computer. The Recovery Manager window will display on-screen.

steps.title: Select “System Recovery” below the section entitled “I need help immediately.
steps.content: Select “System Recovery” below the section entitled “I need help immediately. ”

steps.title: Select “Yes,” then click “Next” when asked if you want the computer restored to its original factory condition.
steps.content: Select “Yes,” then click “Next” when asked if you want the computer restored to its original factory condition. Your computer will reboot, and display the Recovery Manager window once again.

steps.title: Select “System Recovery,” then select “Recover without backing up your files.
steps.content: Select “System Recovery,” then select “Recover without backing up your files. ”

steps.title: Click on “OK” to confirm you want factory settings restored, then select “Finish.
steps.content: Click on “OK” to confirm you want factory settings restored, then select “Finish. ” Your computer will restart and display the Windows 7 setup screen.

steps.title: Back up and save all important documents and files to an external disk, flash drive, or cloud storage system.
steps.content: Back up and save all important documents and files to an external disk, flash drive, or cloud storage system. Restoring the original factory settings will erase all personal data from the computer.

steps.title: Restart your computer and press the left Alt + F10 keys when the Acer logo displays on-screen.
steps.content: Restart your computer and press the left Alt + F10 keys when the Acer logo displays on-screen. This displays the Acer eRecovery Management application. Press “Enter” if the Microsoft Windows boot screen appears to advance to the eRecovery Management window.

steps.title: Select “Completely Restore System to Factory Defaults,” then click “Next.
steps.content: Select “Completely Restore System to Factory Defaults,” then click “Next. ”

steps.title: Click “Next” again to confirm you want to restore the original factory settings.
steps.content: Click “Next” again to confirm you want to restore the original factory settings. The restoration process will begin, which can take anywhere between 10 and 60 minutes. When factory restoration is complete, the Windows 7 setup wizard will display on-screen.

steps.title: Back up and save all important documents and files to an external disk, flash drive, or cloud storage system.
steps.content: Back up and save all important documents and files to an external disk, flash drive, or cloud storage system. Restoring the original factory settings will erase all personal data from the computer.

steps.title: Power off your computer and disconnect any extra accessories or peripherals.
steps.content: Power off your computer and disconnect any extra accessories or peripherals. This includes printers, scanners, network cables, fax machines, and USB drives.

steps.title: Verify that your Toshiba computer is connected to a power source.
steps.content: Verify that your Toshiba computer is connected to a power source. This prevents the computer from powering down during the factory restore process.

steps.title: Restart your computer, then press and hold down the “0” key on the keyboard.
steps.content: Restart your computer, then press and hold down the “0” key on the keyboard. This brings up the recovery warning screen. If the recovery warning screen fails to display, restart your computer and try again.

steps.title: Click on “Yes” to confirm that you want to proceed with system recovery.
steps.content: Click on “Yes” to confirm that you want to proceed with system recovery. This opens the Toshiba Recovery Wizard.

steps.title: Select “Recovery of Factory Software,” then follow the on-screen instructions to restore your computer's original factory settings.
steps.content: Select “Recovery of Factory Software,” then follow the on-screen instructions to restore your computer's original factory settings. Your computer will reboot several times throughout the process, and display the Windows 7 welcome screen when complete. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Back up and save all important documents and files to an external disk, flash drive, or cloud storage system.
steps.content: Back up and save all important documents and files to an external disk, flash drive, or cloud storage system. Restoring the original factory settings will erase all personal data from the computer.

steps.title: Restart your Windows 7 computer, then watch your computer screen to find the appropriate bootup command.
steps.content: Restart your Windows 7 computer, then watch your computer screen to find the appropriate bootup command. In most cases, bootup commands will display at either the top or bottom of your screen.

steps.title: Press the appropriate bootup command to access your computer's recovery partition.
steps.content: Press the appropriate bootup command to access your computer's recovery partition. Bootup commands will vary depending on your computer's manufacturer: Asus: Press F9 Lenovo: Press F11 MSI: Press F3 Samsung: Press F4 Sony: Press F10

steps.title: Select the option to restore your computer to factory settings.
steps.content: Select the option to restore your computer to factory settings. This option is labeled differently for each manufacturer, since each manufacturer uses different software for the built-in recovery partition. In most cases, this option will read as “Restore factory settings” or “Perform factory restore.”

steps.title: Follow the on-screen instructions to restore the original factory settings.
steps.content: Follow the on-screen instructions to restore the original factory settings. Your computer may reboot several times throughout the process, which may take up to one hour to complete. When restoration is finished, the Windows setup wizard or welcome screen will display. [2] X Research source
